comments:
Management 238 is the standard undergraduate course in Organizational Behavior. The course primarily deals with the management of people at work. It examines the individual employee in his organizational environment, as well as the organization itself. Topics range from motivation and leadership groups all the way to organization structure, culture, human resources and organizational change. The course develops themes, such as networking organization and diversity at the workplace, in which these topics become relevant. Students are expected to conduct group projects involving actual fieldwork and might be asked to give a presentation in class.

Student feedback was overwhelmingly positive for the course and most students liked the heavy emphasis on experiential learning and real world applications for course material. 

Many students thought that Professor Grant was an “amazing” professor who had the ability to engage students in an open atmosphere. The professor was able to stimulate students’ interest and skillfully convey course material and data to the class in a fun and light-hearted manner. In addition, the professor takes every opportunity to help his students.

Most students appreciated the applicability of the course and a large number of students agreed that this was the best course they had taken at Wharton.
